title: Mazz_Journey_2
name: Mazz_Journey_2
description: A dataset comprising Father Samuel Mazzuchelli's travels, specifically his mission in the midwestern United States.

properties.name: Mazz born in Milan, 04 Nov 1806
properties.description: Mazz is born in Milan but leaves for a boarding school after the death of his mother six years later.

properties.name: Mazz boarding school, 1814 Lugano, Switzerland
properties.description: It was at this school that Mazz was inspired to become a Dominican.

properties.name: Mazz becomes a Dominican, 06 Dec 1824 Faenza, Italy
properties.description: ti was at the Convent of Sant' Andrea where Mazz studied and joined the OP on 06 December 1824.

properties.name: Mazz enters the fraternal life at Santa Sabina, 1825  Santa Sabina, Rome, Italy
properties.description: Mazz lived as a friar at SAnta Sabina and continued his studies in theology and philosophy, as well as numerous trips to the Holy City and Rome.

properties.name: Mazz leaves for US, 05 Oct 1828  Le Havre, France
properties.description: Mazz boarded the ship Edward Quesnel, captained by Elnathan Hawkins.  it would be a 45 day journedy for Mazz to NYC.  During the trip, the ship went through horrible storms and a stand in the doldrums, unable to make headway for several days.

properties.name: Mazz arrives in US, 14 Nov 1828 NYC
properties.description: After an arduous journey of 45 days, Mazz arrives in the New World at what was once a small dock in New York City.

properties.name: Mazz arrives in Cincinnati, 01 Dec 1828
properties.description: After  long stagecoach and riverboat rides totalling over 900 miles, Mazz arrives at Cincinnati, welcomed by Bishop Edward Fenwick.

properties.name: Mazz is ordained, 1829, 1830  Somerset, OH
properties.description: Mazz receives his ordination as deacon on 29 November 1829, and his priesthod on 05 Sep 1830.

properties.name: Mazz in Mackinac Island, 11 Oct 1830
properties.description: Mazz is sent to MAckinac Island to reinvigorate the Dominican way with the people of Mackinac Island and the northern Midwest, particularly the Frenc Canadian furt trappers and the native Metis on Mackinac Island.  It was here that MAzz built his first school.

properties.name: Mazz in Green Bay, June 1831
properties.description: Mazz planted several churches and schools in and around the young city of Green Bay from 1831-34.

properties.name: Mazz builds churches, 1835 - 1842
properties.description: Mazz builds churches throughout the Midwest, primarily in Iowa, Illinois, and Wisconsin

properties.name: Mazz builds churches, 1835-1842
properties.description: Mazz builds churches throughout the Midwest, primarily in Iowa, Illinois, and Wisconsin.  Overall, he founded over 30 parishes and built over 20 churches during his tenure in the Midwest, most of them built duirng this seven-year period.

properties.name: Mazz builds churches, 1835-1842
properties.description: Mazz builds churches throughout the Midwest, primarily in Iowa, Illinois, and Wisconsin.  Overall, he founded over 30 parishes and built over 20 churches during his tenure in the Midwest, most of them built duirng this seven-year period.

properties.name: Mazz builds churches, 1835-1842
properties.description: Mazz builds churches throughout the Midwest, primarily in Iowa, Illinois, and Wisconsin.  Overall, he founded over 30 parishes and built over 20 churches during his tenure in the Midwest, most of them built duirng this seven-year period.

properties.name: Mazz builds churches, 1835-1842
properties.description: Mazz builds churches throughout the Midwest, primarily in Iowa, Illinois, and Wisconsin.  Overall, he founded over 30 parishes and built over 20 churches during his tenure in the Midwest, most of them built duirng this seven-year period.

properties.name: Mazzbegins the Sinsinawa Mound Novitiate, 06 July 1845
properties.description: Mazz receives approval from the holy See to crate a novitiate on the Sinsinawa Mound site.  Bishop Henni dedicates the site on 03 Aug 1845.

properties.name: Mazz lays cornerstone of Sinsinawa Mound College, 24 May 1846
properties.description: Mazz sts the cornerstone for a college dedicated to the teaching of science, theology and philosophy for those willing to attend.  It was the first degree-granting institution in the upper Mississippi region and the fourth chartered church in Wisconsin, on 11 March 1848.
